question:
With regards to the UGC’s reform measures to curb plagiarism in higher studies and research, consider the following statements:
  1. The anti-plagiarism software Urkund is an indigenous creation.
  2. The UGC has given provisions for penalising plagiarism depending on severity of offence from Bachelors level onwards.
  3. The Balram panel of UGC had highlighted the role of plagiarism in hurting Indian research.
Which of the above statements are correct? Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: UGC has declared the Urkund software’s use on a trial run by universities across India. The Urkund software is to be given to all 900 universities free of cost. It is an anti-plagiarism software from Sweden. It will replace the more expensive currently used counterpart Turnitin. The software will be available to teachers, students, etc. Statement 2 is incorrect: The UGC has given regulations for dealing with plagiarism in 2018. It has called for setting up of panels to address complaints. It has also created a four level penalty setup- with increasing penalties for increased level of plagiarism- level one (upto 40%) will call for resubmission of revised work in 6 months, level 2 (40%-60%) will lead to debarment of submission for one year, level 3 (above 60%) leading to expulsion. The penalties apply from Masters Level and above. Statement 3 is correct: The Balram panel was constituted by UGC for reviewing the research environment in India. It is headed by former director of IISc Bangalore, P. Balram. The 4 member panel had made a several observations and suggestions for improving the field. Rampant plagiarism and increased use of fake journals by Indian academics was highlighted.
